subject: Climate & Environment
title: Extended Producer Responsibility
description: A micro-lesson that makes Extended Producer Responsibility usable.

hook.text: Should the company that makes the packaging also pay to clean it up? More countries say yes.

buildup.text: Extended Producer Responsibility makes manufacturers fund the collection and recycling of their products.

discovery.text: Europe pioneered EPR in the 1990s. It dramatically increased packaging recycling rates.

twist.text: When companies pay for waste, they design less wasteful packaging â€” the incentive aligns.

climax.text: Over 400 EPR programs now exist worldwide. The UN plastic treaty may make them mandatory.

punchline.text: When the bill goes to the maker, the mess gets smaller.

quiz.question: What does Extended Producer Responsibility require?
options: Manufacturers fund waste collection and recycling
